definition: to become visible/to reveal
to make visible/to reveal/prominent/conspicuous/(prefix) phanero-
to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
dew/syrup/nectar/outdoors (not under cover)/to show/to reveal/to betray/to expose
surname Lu
to appear/to come out in the open

sentences.english: Self-revelation is at the same time self-destruction.
sentences.chinese: 自我显露同时也是自我毁灭。

sentences.english: It is in times of adversities that your true character and qualities are shown.
sentences.chinese: 四面楚歌之时，正是你显露不凡气概与特质的机会。

sentences.english: Diazinon and chlorpyrifos, too, were eventually revealed to be hazardous.
sentences.chinese: 二嗪农和毒死蜱也逐渐显露出危险性。
我不能把恐惧显露出来。

sentences.english: After they cut through more layers of steel, a hidden trap finally appeared.
sentences.chinese: 又锯掉了几层钢板之后，一个暗藏的玄机终于显露。

sentences.english: That zealotry first revealed itself when he was a teenager.
sentences.chinese: 这狂热的第一次显露了出来，当他是少年。

sentences.english: Just over each temple there were little blue veins .
sentences.chinese: 就在两鬓太阳穴上面显露著青色的细小静脉。

sentences.english: A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may discover itself.
sentences.chinese: 愚昧人不喜爱明哲，只喜爱显露心意。

sentences.english: Choleric people don't cry easily or show much emotion at all.
sentences.chinese: 暴躁的人不会轻易哭泣，或显露过多的情绪。

sentences.english: I would like to end by thanking God for the small mercies he has shown us at this dreadful time.
sentences.chinese: 感谢上帝在这个可怕的时代向我们显露的悲悯。

sentences.english: Even as a child he showed an unusual aptitude for mathematics.
sentences.chinese: 甚至孩童时他就显露出非统一般的数学才能。

sentences.english: The person that hides in darkness is many a also show true colour.
sentences.chinese: 藏在黑暗中的人也一个一个的显露真颜。

sentences.english: Her true motives only emerged later.
sentences.chinese: 她的现实念头是厥后才显露的。

sentences.english: This tax inspector was demonstrating one of the most common of human frailties .
sentences.chinese: 这位稽查员，显露出一种最常见到的人性的弱点。

sentences.english: Only when doing things alone can he show his paces.
sentences.chinese: 只有单干的时候他才能显露出自己的真本事。

sentences.english: A wise teacher never shows favouritism.
sentences.chinese: 聪明的老师从不显露偏心。

definition: to expose/to reveal
to appear/to come out in the open
completely/fully/without omission
appearance/to appear
to express/to exhibit
to expose/to reveal/to lay bare/also pr. [pu4 lu4]
hidden/covered/concealed
to show/to reveal (one's feelings etc)
to present clearly/to give prominence to/to magnify/clear and obvious
conspicuous/to make sth stand out/make sth prominent
to lay bare/to come to light
to come to prominence/to appear clearly/to stick out
to cover/to mask/to cover up or conceal (the truth etc)
to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc
to expose (to the air, light etc)/to leave uncovered/exposure
exposed/appearing on the outside
